story.storykicker: Students, seeking admissions in BA, BCom programmes, would be allowed to include vocational subjects while calculating the best four subjects from this year onwards.
story.storybody:
In a major relief to students seeking admissions in BA, BCom programmes, the university will allow the students to put vocational subjects among the best four subjects. The rule will be applicable from this year onwards, and the students will not face any disadvantage.

Until last year, if a student included vocational subject's marks while calculating his/her best four subject's (BFS) marks in these two courses, they were penalised with a deduction of 2.5 per cent marks from each subject.

(Read: Delhi University Admissions process begins: How to apply )

How does the change impact students?

  • If a student obtains good marks in physical education, sculpture, web-designing or painting, one is allowed to put the marks of the subject while calculating BFS along with one language and two other subjects.
  • If a student wishes to change his stream, such as commerce student wants to enroll in BA Programme, in such a case the deduction will be of not more than 5 per cent. This percentage is itself decided by the college.
Also, this new rule is applicable on these two courses only. For all other courses, candidates should include one language and three other academic subjects listed by the university while calculating the BFS.

 

(READ: The rush to Delhi University: Is it really worth it?)

Other changes made this year:

  • This year the list of academic subjects has been widened, now it also includes Legal studies, accountancy, business studies.
  • Inclusion of language in the calculation of BFS is an important aspect for BSc (hons) in physical and life sciences. For physical science course, students need to calculate the marks of physics, chemistry and mathematics (PCM) and for life science it is physics, chemistry and biology.
  • However, for certain other courses like BCom and economics (Hons), it is mandatory for students to have studied mathematics.
  • Also, for admissions in BCom (hons)/ BCom courses Business mathematics, will be treated as equivalent to mathematics.
  • Moreover, marks scored in maths have to be added to the BFS; in case, a student wants to study mathematics, statistics, computer science (hons).
